CatDescriptText: Mr. James Anderson, coffee shop employee, 2237 Bloomer Way, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 22, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the visit of the Russian ruler, Khrushchev, will promote world peace?" answer reads: "In a way, yes. It depends, however, on whether or not something is said out of the way which will start an argument.  We should treat him the way the Russians treated Nixon.  I think the benefit will result in a better understanding."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Anderson wearing light colored hat, moustache, light colored short sleeve shirt with "Myron" embroidered above left breast pocket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Bud Saunders Flowers, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
